Description: Cuboid (rectangular) weight carved from greenish grey hard stone, with some beige veins; polished surface; complete.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Oriental Institute, University of Chicago. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Square and parallelepiped weights are commonly found in Egypt and appear rather conspicuously in Naukratis (Petrie 1886, pl. XXIII). They were manufactured in a large range of material: they were more often made of all sorts of hard stones, especially white limestone, alabaster but also various colourful stone such as marble, serpentine, porphyry (etc.); in Naukratis, such shapes occur also regularly in basalt, diorite, granite and sandstone; bronze and lead examples are at last quite numerous (Cour-Marty 1990, 26-27, fig. 9-10, fig. 13). Weights of this type in igneous rock, such as this specimen, are mainly in use during the Late Period and associated to the Egyptian standard deben-kedet (Cour-Marty 1990, 27). However, this weight seems more related to a lighter unit: its mass is similar to the standard Near Eastern shekel of 8,3 gr well attested in this period (Kroll 2003, 317). Cour-Marty, M.-A. 1989. Les poids dans l’Égypte ancienne, Vols. 1-3 [unpublished thesis, microform], Paris. Cour-Marty, M.-A. 1990, 'Les poids égyptiens, de précieux jalons archéologiques', Cahier de Recherches de l'Institut de Papyrologie et d'Egyptologie de Lille 12, 17-55. Kroll, J. H. 2003. ‘Weights, bullion, currency, coinage’, in N. Ch. Stampolidis and V. Karageorghis (eds), Ploes. Sea Routes …Interconnections in the Mediterranean, c. 1600-600 BC, Procedings of the International Symposium held in Rethymnon, Crete September 29th-October 2, 2002, Athens, 313-323. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884–5 (third memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Petrie, W. M. F. 1926, Ancient Weights and Measures Illustrated by the Egyptian Collection in University College, London.
